captions.text: - I think I know what Synesthesia is.

- It's sort of like what
happens when you're tripping.
("Future Trap" by DarkstarMuzic)
- Different parts of your brain

control the sensation of
the perception of vision,
or of hearing, or of smell, or of taste,

and a lot of those areas
in the brain are neighbors.
My name is Nadia Ortelt
and I'm a DIY Neuroscientist.
In some people the connection
between those neighboring areas
is much stronger than in other people,
and those people have Synesthesia.

They can see colors
associated with numbers,
or shapes, or letters, or words.
- I'm Jordan.
- I'm Justin.
- And we both have Synesthesia,
and we're dating.
Well, I see every letter has a color,
and every number has a color.
- So, I had it my whole life
and I thought it was totally normal
to associate colors
and numbers and letters in my head.
- All my numbers are,
they kind of correspond with the rainbow.
I have like ideas about,
like the personality of numbers.
"Seven" is kind of a jerk.
"Three" is like a really nice guy,
it's a good number.
- [Nadia] People with Synesthesia

are usually much better
at memorizing things
because they always have two associations
with every idea, or object, or thing.

- I remember distinctly
like when I was a little kid
remembering my phone number,
my first phone number, with colors.
Green, green, gold, red, red, gold, gold.
- My name's actually really ugly,
I don't like the way it looks.
("Future Trap" by DarkstarMuzic)
- [Nadia] Synesthesia is actually
a really common condition,

but also it's how our brains
work most of the time.

So you can do this
really simple experiment

at home to see what Synesthesia
actually looks like.
Cut out a bunch of shapes,

some like this, that are
kind of pointy and spiky,

and some like this, which
are round and a bit softer.

Put all these shapes
in front of your friend
and ask him to associate the two of them
with one of two categories,
one which is a nonsense word "kiki",

and the other which is
a nonsense word "bouba".
- Who are "kiki" and "bouba"?
- They're like Miyasaki characters.

- [Nadia] "kiki" kind of
sounds like spiky and sharp,
and "bouba" kind of sounds round and soft.

And you'll find that
actually everybody associates
these types of shapes with "kiki"
and these types of shapes with "bouba".
- Everyone feels this way?
- That's creepy.
- No, that's not how it works,
is that how it works?
- I have no control over my mind.
- Oh! That looks exactly like what I did.
I guess everyone has
a little bit of Synesthesia in them.
Wow!
("Future Trap" by DarkstarMuzic)

comments.text:
I associate numbers with colors, except I didn't know it wasn't normal. For 
example, I see 1 as a blue number. If I were to take each letter of my name 
and associate it with its matching color, this is what it would look like: 
Orange, pink, green, red, yellow (my first name), and Yellow, pink, orange, 
green, blue, red. ﻿
comments.author: Casey Taylor

comments.text: That completely failed to answer the question ﻿
comments.author: caitlin colman

comments.text: WTF MY DOGS NAMES ARE KIKI AND BOBO﻿

comments.author: Samanatha Harris

comments.text:
I do the color thing with numbers (I honestly though everyone did). A lot 
of them are singular colors, but many (espeically in the double digets) are 
multi-colored.

1 is like a deep, dark, rich red, like dark red velvet.
2 is a poppy, vivid blue.
3 is a lime green
4 is blue, but more of a dark, navy blue.
5 is fire engine red
6 is a light shade of hot pink
7 is a darker green, like forest green
8 is a super SUPER dark blue, almost black
9 is like orange, but more of a yellow-orange
10 is black and white
11 is grey
12 is a mix of white, dark blue, and grey
13 is a milky green
14 is a very light, baby sky blue
15 is a deeper hot pink
16 is a milky pink
17 is green, like the plain "green" crayola crayon
18 is a mix of black and dark blue
19 is dark orange and bright yellow
20 is a mix of royal purple and dark blue

Those are the only ones that are in order, but I also have a color for 62: 
a mix of magenta and dark purple﻿
comments.author: IcewhipRoxx

loyal and trust worthy. 9 wants to succeed more than anything but always 
falls short. ﻿
